titleStmt.title: A svvarme of sectaries, and schismatiques: wherein is discovered the strange preaching (or prating) of such as are by their trades coblers, tinkers, pedlers, weavers, sowgelders, and chymney-sweepers. By John Taylor. The cobler preaches, and his audience are as wise as Mosse was, when he caught his mare.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

publicationStmt.publisher: s.n.]Printed luckily, and may be read unhappily, betwixt hawke and buzzard,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
